meta.description: Evidence bundle specification and JSON schemas

The schema appears to have no connascence coupling issues. The scanner correctly found no violations. The schema uses references and enums appropriately without introducing unnecessary dependencies or shared state. All type definitions are self-contained or properly referenced, minimizing coupling.

findings.description: Missing encryption for ePHI at rest. The schema does not include any requirements for encrypting data stored on disk.
Lack of specific provisions for securing data during storage. The schema does not include any requirements for securing evidence bundles in long-term storage.
The description field for cryptographic signatures lacks explicit encryption mechanisms for ePHI integrity as required by HIPAA-312.c.1
The $schema field contains unencrypted data in transit, violating HIPAA-312.e.1 requirements for ePHI encryption
The $id field contains unencrypted data in transit, violating HIPAA-312.e.1 requirements for ePHI encryption
The certificate_chain field in the Signature definition lacks proper encryption mechanisms for ePHI in transit, violating HIPAA-312.e.1
